verses.verse: And Job<WH347> answered<WH6030> and said<WH559>,
No doubt<WH551> but you are the people<WH5971>, and wisdom<WH2451> shall die with you<WH4191>.
But<WH1571> I have understanding<WH3824> as well as you<WH5307>; I am not inferior to you<WH3644>: Yes, who knows not such things as these?
I am as one mocked<WH7814> of his neighbor<WH7453>, who calls<WH7121> upon God<WH433>, and he answers<WH6030> him<WH6662>: the just upright<WH8549> man is laughed to scorn<WH7814>.
He that is ready<WH3559> to slip<WH4571> with his feet<WH7272> is as a lamp<WH3940> despised<WH937> in the thought<WH6248> of him that is at ease<WH7600>.
The tabernacles<WH168> of robbers<WH7703> prosper<WH7951>, and they that provoke<WH7264> God<WH410> are secure<WH987>; into whose hand<WH3027> God<WH433> brings abundantly<WH935>.
But<WH199> ask<WH7592> now the animals<WH929>, and they shall teach<WH3384> you<WH5775>; and the birds of the air<WH8064>, and they shall tell you<WH5046>:
Or speak<WH7878> to the earth<WH776>, and it shall teach<WH3384> you<WH1709>: and the fish of the sea<WH3220> shall declare unto you<WH5608>.
Who knows<WH3045> not in all these that the hand<WH3027> of the Lord<WH3068> has done this<WH6213>?
In whose hand<WH3027> is the soul<WH5315> of every living thing<WH2416>, and the breath<WH7307> of all mankind<WH376>.
Does not the ear<WH241> try<WH974> words<WH4405>? and the mouth<WH2441> taste<WH2938> his food<WH400>?
With the ancient<WH3453> is wisdom<WH2451>; and in length<WH753> of days<WH3117> understanding<WH8394>.
With him is wisdom<WH2451> and strength<WH1369>, he has counsel<WH6098> and understanding<WH8394>.
Behold<WH2040>, he breaks down, and it cannot be built again<WH1129>: he shuts up<WH5462> a man<WH376>, and there can be no opening<WH6605>.
Behold<WH6113>, he withholds the waters<WH4325>, and they dry up<WH3001>: also he sends them out<WH7971>, and they overturn<WH2015> the earth<WH776>.
With him is strength<WH5797> and wisdom<WH8454>: the deceived<WH7683> and the deceiver are his<WH7686>.
He leads<WH3212> counselors<WH3289> away spoiled<WH7758>, and makes the judges<WH8199> fools<WH1984>.
He loosens<WH6605> the bond<WH4148> of kings<WH4428>, and yokes<WH631> their body<WH4975> with a belt<WH232>.
He leads<WH3212> princes<WH3548> away spoiled<WH7758>, and overthrows<WH5557> the mighty<WH386>.
He removes away<WH5493> the speech<WH8193> of the trusty<WH539>, and takes away<WH3947> the understanding<WH2940> of the aged<WH2205>.
He pours<WH8210> contempt<WH937> upon princes<WH5081>, and weakens<WH7503> the strength<WH4206> of the mighty<WH650>.
He discovers<WH1540> deep things<WH6013> out of darkness<WH2822>, and brings out<WH3318> to light<WH216> the shadow of death<WH6757>.
He increases<WH7679> the nations<WH1471>, and destroys<WH6> them<WH7849>: he enlarges the nations<WH1471>, and captures them again<WH5148>.
He takes away<WH5493> the heart<WH3820> of the chief<WH7218> of the people<WH5971> of the earth<WH776>, and causes them to wander<WH8582> in a wilderness<WH8414> where there is no way<WH1870>.
They grope<WH4959> in the dark<WH2822> without light<WH216>, and he makes them to stagger<WH8582> like a drunken man<WH7910>.
